page_analysis.text_content:
What counts as floor area summary

Architectural feature	Counts?	Illustration

Porches & entry features
• Unenclosed porches	No	Fig 5 on pp. 8-10
• Enclosed porches	Once	Fig 5 on pp. 8-10
• Entry feature ≤ 12' in height	No	Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13
• Entry feature > 12' in height	Twice (footprint)	Figs 6-8 on pp. 11-13
• 1st floor recessed porches < 10' in depth and open on exterior side	No	Fig 9 on p. 14
• 2nd floor roofed or enclosed porches, arcades, balconies, porticos, breezeways	Once	Fig 10 on p. 15

Attics & equivalencies
• Attic space where floor to under side of roof rafter distance is < 5'	No	Fig 11 on p. 16
• All 2nd floor space (including attics) where head height or distance from top of floor to bottom of rafter is ≥ 5'	Once	Fig 11 on p. 16
• 2nd floor equivalent: areas where height from top of first floor to top of roof material is > 17'	Twice	Fig 12 on p. 17
• 3rd floor equivalent: areas where height from top of first floor to top of roof material is > 26'	Three times	Fig 12 on p. 17
  o Exemption: 3rd floor equivalent, where roof pitch is ≥ 4:12	200 sf exempt
  o Exemption: Unusable attic space for Category 1 & 2 historic homes	500 sf exempt

Basements
• Basements that comply with patio & lightwell requirements of 18.12.070	No	Figs 35, 36, 39, 40 on pp. 39-43
• Basements of Category 1 & 2 historic homes or contributing structures in a historic district (even if > 3')	No

Other
• Bay windows (if ≥ 18" above interior flr, does not project > 2', and > 50% windows)	No	Fig 13 on p. 18
• Architectural appendages like fireplace or buttress footprint	Once	Fig 14 on p. 19

Accessory structures
• Accessory structures >120 sf	Once
• Garages and carports	Once
• Porte cocheres	No

visual_elements.description: A table summarizing architectural features, whether they count towards floor area, and references to illustrations. The table is divided into categories: Porches & entry features, Attics & equivalencies, Basements, Other, and Accessory structures. Each row lists a specific architectural feature, its count status (No, Once, Twice, Three times), and illustration references with figure numbers and page numbers.

technical_specifications.parameter: Attic space floor to underside of roof rafter distance
Head height or distance from top of floor to bottom of rafter
Height from top of first floor to top of roof material (2nd floor equivalent)
Height from top of first floor to top of roof material (3rd floor equivalent)
Roof pitch exemption for 3rd floor equivalent
Exemption for 3rd floor equivalent roof pitch
Exemption for unusable attic space for Category 1 & 2 historic homes
Bay windows height above interior floor

structural_elements.main_heading: What counts as floor area summary

additional_notes: Page number '5' printed at bottom right corner.
No handwritten annotations, stamps, or markings detected.
Text is clear and legible with no quality issues.
cross_references: Reference to patio & lightwell requirements of 18.12.070

qualifiers.text: Basements that comply with patio & lightwell requirements of 18.12.070
Basements of Category 1 & 2 historic homes or contributing structures in a historic district (even if > 3')
Bay windows (if ≥ 18" above interior flr, does not project > 2', and > 50% windows)
Exemption: 3rd floor equivalent, where roof pitch is ≥ 4:12
Exemption: Unusable attic space for Category 1 & 2 historic homes

conditions.text: Basements that comply with patio & lightwell requirements of 18.12.070 count as No floor area
Basements of Category 1 & 2 historic homes or contributing structures in a historic district (even if > 3') count as No floor area
Bay windows (if ≥ 18" above interior floor, does not project > 2', and > 50% windows) count as No floor area
3rd floor equivalent exemption applies where roof pitch is ≥ 4:12
Unusable attic space exemption applies for Category 1 & 2 historic homes

logical_relationships.expression: Bay windows (if ≥ 18" above interior flr, does not project > 2', and > 50% windows) count as No floor area

execution_sequence.action: Evaluate if basement complies with patio & lightwell requirements of 18.12.070
Evaluate if basement is Category 1 & 2 historic home or contributing structure in historic district
Evaluate bay window conditions (height, projection, window percentage)
Check roof pitch for 3rd floor equivalent exemption
Check unusable attic space exemption for Category 1 & 2 historic homes
